Class MoveRegistration

java.lang.Object
game.core.MoveRegistration
public class MoveRegistration extends Object
Manages move registration, validation, and history tracking for a Hex game.

This class handles:

  • Recording all moves made during the game
  • Validating move legality before registration
  • Managing turn alternation between players
  • Providing move history display and undo functionality
  • Interactive move input from console

Players are represented as integers: 1 for red, 2 for black (blue).

  • Constructor Details

      public MoveRegistration()

  • Method Details

    • registerMove

      public boolean registerMove(int[][] board, int row, int col)
      Attempts to register a move on the board at the specified coordinates.

      This method validates that the move is within board bounds and targets an empty cell. If valid, it places the current player's mark, records the move in history, and switches to the other player's turn.

      Parameters:
      board - the game board represented as a 2D integer array
      row - the row coordinate of the move
      col - the column coordinate of the move
      Returns:
      true if the move was valid and successfully registered, false if invalid

    • getMove

      public void getMove(int[][] board)
      Prompts the current player to input a move via the console and registers it.

      This method repeatedly prompts the player until a valid move is entered. Invalid moves (out of bounds or occupied cells) display error messages and request new input.

      Parameters:
      board - the game board represented as a 2D integer array

    • printMoveHistory

      public void printMoveHistory()
      Displays the complete history of all moves made during the game. Each move is printed in the format "PlayerN:(row,col)". If no moves have been made, a corresponding message is displayed.

    • undoLastMove

      public boolean undoLastMove(Board board)
      Undoes the most recent move by removing it from history and clearing the corresponding cell on the board.

      This method parses the last move from the history, clears that cell on the board, and switches back to the player who made the undone move (so they can make a different move).

      Parameters:
      board - the Board instance to modify
      Returns:
      true if a move was successfully undone, false if there were no moves to undo

    • getMoves

      public ArrayList<String> getMoves()
      Returns the complete list of moves made during the game.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all moves in chronological order, each formatted as "PlayerN:(row,col)"
